page.title: 06Sharnbrook Upper School
page.content: {Sharnbrook Upper School}opened in 1975 with 235 pupils aged 13.Each following year another group of 13 year olds joined the school until, in 1980, there were{pupils aged from 13 to 18. There are 930 pupils in the school, mainly coming from villages in{North {Bedfordshire.} Most of them travel to school by coach. The school is part of a{Community {College}which organises lots of educational and recreational activities and courses for adults, both during the day, and in the evenings. Over 1000 adults enrolled for the courses in 1984-5. The activities and courses include Keep Fit, Be Your Own Boss, Local History, Using Your Micro, Horsemastership and many others. There are a number of courses leading up to{public {examinations.
